cab.content: CONFIDENTIAL LIBRARY,This document is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government)gCRET.. .P.44 (23).CABINET..HOME AFFAIRS COMMITTEE.LEGITIMACY BILL.Memorandum by the Home Secretary.Amongst the Bills to be introduced in the House of Lords there might be included the Legitimacy Bill which passed the Lords last Session but made no progress in the Commons. This Bill was included in the Prime Minister's Election Address and in the King's Speech in -December, 1924. There is general agreement on the principle of the measure, but there are point connected with it which lead to discussion and the difficulty has been to find time for the Bill.W.J.H.5th. (1) Where the parents of an illegitimate person marry one another, whether before or after the com-mencement of this Act, and the father of the illegitimate person was, or is, at the time of the marriage domiciled in a country, other than England or Wales, by the law of which the illegitimate person became legitimated by virtue of such subsequent marriage, that person shall in England and Wales be recognised as having been so legitimated, notwithstanding that his father was not at the time of the birth of such person domiciled in a country where such a rule of law prevailed.(2) The provisions of this Act with respect to legitimated persons and to the issue of illegitimate persons in cases where such persons died before the marriage of their parents shall apply respectively to persons recognised as having been legitimated and to the issue of any person who would have been so recognised if he had been living at the time of the 25 marriage of his parents:Provided that nothing in this subsection] shall affect . the right of any person under any intestacy occurring, will (incluchng codicil) coming into operation, or settlement or other disposition made, before the commencement of 30 this Act to which he would have been entitled if this Act had not been passed.(3) Eor the purposes of this section, the expression " country " includes Scotland and any other part of His Majesty's Dominions, as well as a foreign country.206011. (1) Where, after the commencement of this Act, the mother of an illegitimate child dies intestate, as respects all or any of her real or personal property, the illegitimate child or, if he is dead, his issue shall be entitled to take any interest therein to which he or such 4( issue would have been entitled if he had been born legitimate.Death duties. 10(2) Where, after the commencement of this Act, an A.D. 1925. illegitimate child dies intestate in respect of all or any of his real or personal property, his mother if surviving shall be entitled to take any interest therein to which she would have been entitled if the child had been born legitimate and she was the only smwiving parent.(3) This section does not affect the descent of an estate tail or other entailed interest in real or personal property.(4) This section shall apply to Scotland with the substitution of "heritable " for "real"and "moveable" for " personal."
